title: How Many Calories in a Cheesesteak?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cheesesteak, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for a standard Philly-style sandwich.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cheesesteak?
assumptions: Standard Philly cheesesteak: 6 oz thinly sliced ribeye steak, provolone cheese, grilled onions, on a 10-inch hoagie roll; no extra condiments.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, portion size, cheese type, roll brand, and add-ons like sauces or peppers. Check menus or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard cheesesteak sandwich contains about 800 calories and 45 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cheesesteak without cheese?
faqs.a: About 600 calories, subtracting ~200 from the cheese.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a standard cheesesteak?
faqs.a: Roughly 45 g protein, 40 g fat, 70 g carbs, and 800 kcal total.

faqs.q: Is a Philly cheesesteak high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1500 mg due to cheese, steak, and roll seasonings.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in a cheesesteak?
faqs.a: Larger 8 oz steak versions can add 200+ calories; smaller portions reduce them.
Opt for chicken, whole wheat roll, or veggies like peppers to cut 100-200 kcal.
